answers.answer: Hello,you need to see your doctor as soon as possible and discuss an appropriate management plan and get it implemented as soon as possible.  It is very important to control blood sugar during pregnancy both for you and the baby.Most likely you will be taking insulin.  A lower carb diet will help to reduce how much insulin you need.  Exercise will also help.You should also get a blood sugar meter and test your blood usgars fasting and after eating.  Target fasting blood sugar is < 95, and target post eating should be < 140.Let us know how you go.

question: I have diabetes type 2 almost 6 years ago. And now im pregnant 8 weeks..  im worried about this.. could you please help me to maintain my blood sugar..
title: need help.
